revised_title: Assessing Photosynthetic Performance in Crops Using Quantum Yield and Chlorophyll Fluorescence
tldr: The authors developed an apparatus to measure the quantum yield of carbon assimilation and chlorophyll fluorescence in field-grown crops. They found that the quantum yield and the ratio of variable to maximal fluorescence increased from May to August and decreased in September. The results showed a linear correlation between the quantum yield and the fluorescence ratio, and the efficiency of light-energy conversion to dry matter by the crop was correlated with changes in the quantum yield during the growing season.
